chrom.description: A string specifying the chromosome of region to be plotted

chromstart.description: An integer start position on chromosome to be plotted

chromend.description: An integer end position on chromosome to be plotted

assembly.description: A string specifying the default genome assembly or a\link[plotgardener]{assembly} object.Default value is \code{assembly = "hg38"}

fill.description: A character value(s) as a single value or vectorspecifying fill colors of transcripts.Default value is \code{fill = c("#669fd9", "#abcc8e")}

colorbyStrand.description: A logical value indicating whether tocolor plus and minus strands by the first two colors ina \code{fill} vector, where plus strand transcripts will becolored by the first \code{fill} color andminus strand transcripts will be colored by the second \code{fill}color. Default value is \code{colorbyStrand = TRUE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

strandSplit.description: A logical value indicating whether plus andminus-stranded transcripts should be separated, with plus strandtranscripts plotted above the x-axis and minus strand transcriptsplotted below the x-axis. Default value is \code{strandSplit = FALSE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

boxHeight.description: A numeric or unit object specifying height of transcripts.Default value is \code{boxHeight = unit(2, "mm")}

spaceWidth.description: A numeric value specifying the width of minimum spacingbetween transcripts, as a fraction of the plot's genomic range.Default value is \code{spaceWidth = 0.02}

spaceHeight.description: A numeric value specifying the height of spacingbetween transcripts on different rows, as a fraction of \code{boxHeight}.Default value is \code{spaceHeight = 0.3}

limitLabel.description: A logical value indicating whether to draw a "+"when not all elements can be plotted in the plotting space. Defaultvalue is \code{limitLabel = TRUE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

transcriptHighlights.description: A two-column dataframe with a column named"transcript" or "gene" containing transcript names or their associated genenames as strings to highlight and a column named "color" containingcorresponding highlight colors

fontsize.description: A numeric specifying text fontsize in points.Default value is \code{fontsize = 8}

stroke.description: A numeric value indicating the stroke width fortranscript body outlines. Default value is \code{stroke = 0.1}

bg.description: A character value indicating background color.Default value is \code{bg = NA}

x.description: A numeric or unit object specifying transcript plot x-location

y.description: A numeric, unit object, or character containing a "b"combined with a numeric value specifying transcript plot y-location.The character value willplace the transcript plot y relative to the bottom of the most recentlyplotted plot according to the units of the plotgardener page

width.description: A numeric or unit object specifying transcript plot width

height.description: A numeric or unit object specifying transcript plot height

just.description: A string specifying the justification of transcript plot relative toits (x, y) location. If there are two values, the first value specifieshorizontal justification and the second value specifies verticaljustification.Possible string values are: \code{"left"}, \code{"right"},\code{"centre"}, \code{"center"}, \code{"bottom"}, and \code{"top"}.Default value is \code{just = c("left", "top")}. Options include: c("left", "top"), c("left", "bottom"), "left", c("right", "top"), c("right", "bottom"), "right", "top", "bottom", "center"

default.units.description: A string indicating the default units to use if\code{x}, \code{y}, \code{width}, or \code{height} are only given asnumerics. Default value is \code{default.units = "inches"}. Options include: "inches", "cm", "npc", "snpc", "native", "mm", "points"

draw.description: A logical value indicating whether graphics output should beproduced. Default value is \code{draw = TRUE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

params.description: An optional \link[plotgardener]{pgParams} object containingrelevant function parameters.\end}}\value{Returns a \code{transcripts} object containing relevantgenomic region, placement, and \link[grid]{grob} information
